items.title: Baidu to offer AI chatbot free for all users starting April
items.summary:
- Baidu will make its AI chatbot, Ernie Bot, free for all users starting Apr. 1, citing advancements in technology and reduced operational costs.
- The chatbot will be accessible on desktop and mobile, with a new advanced search feature to enhance reasoning and tool integration.
- This decision comes as competition increases in China's AI market, with rivals like DeepSeek providing free chatbot services.
- In late 2023, Baidu launched premium Ernie 4.0 features priced at 59.9 yuan (US$8.18) per month, claiming performance on par with GPT-4.

items.title: Thai healthtech HD raises $7.8m, backed by US pharma giant
items.summary:
- Thai healthcare startup HD raised $7.8 million in equity funding from US pharmaceutical giant Merck Sharp & Dohme (MSD).
- This funding round also included investors like SBI Ven Capital, M Venture Partners, FEBE Venture, and Partech Partners.
- HD operates HDmall, a platform connecting users with hospitals for various medical services and surgeries.
- The funds will be used to enhance AI capabilities and expand the marketplace.
- Since its inception, HD has included 2,500 hospitals and clinics and served over 400,000 customers in Thailand and Indonesia.
- In 2024, HD launched Jib AI, a chatbot that manages 60% of customer interactions, with future plans for additional features.

items.title: AI-powered legal platform SpotDraft raises $54m series B
items.summary:
- SpotDraft raised US$54 million in a Series B round, led by Vertex Growth and Trident Partners.
- Funds will be used for market expansion, hiring leadership, and enhancing AI-powered contract management.
- Founded in 2017, SpotDraft assists in redlining, e-signatures, and managing third-party contracts, serving clients like Spendlfo and Crunchbase.
- Previous funding rounds included US$26 million in Series A (2023) and US$1.5 million in 2019.
- SpotDraft operates in Bengaluru and New York.

items.title: MyFitnessPal acquires meal-planning startup Intent
items.summary:
- MyFitnessPal has acquired meal-planning startup Intent in 2024.
- Intent's technology helps create personalized meal plans based on allergens, calorie goals, and dietary preferences.
- A new subscription plan, "Premium Plus," will be launched in late spring 2025 for $99.99 annually, with a waitlist opened.
- MyFitnessPal, which has 270 million users, aims to enhance meal planning with this acquisition, its first since being bought for $345 million in 2020.

items.title: Lyft stocks drops 7.9% after weak Q4 results
items.summary:
- Lyft’s stock fell 7.9% on Feb. 12 after reporting weak Q4 results and lower bookings guidance due to pricing cuts.
- Revenue reported at US$1.55 billion, slightly below the expected US$1.56 billion, with a 27% year-over-year increase.
- Bookings totaled US$4.28 billion, missing FactSet's US$4.32 billion estimate; expected next quarter bookings range lowered to US$4.05 billion - US$4.20 billion.
- Adjusted earnings per share were 29 cents, surpassing forecasts of 22 cents.
- Lyft reported 24.7 million active riders in Q4, exceeding expectations.

items.title: Adtech firm AppLovin’s shares jump 30% on strong Q4 earnings
items.summary:
- AppLovin’s shares increased nearly 30% on Feb. 12 following strong Q4 earnings report.
- EPS reported at US$1.73, exceeding the expected US$1.24.
- Revenue reached US$1.37 billion, surpassing analysts’ projection of US$1.26 billion.
- Net income rose to US$599.2 million compared to US$172.3 million the previous year.
- Advertising revenue increased by 73% to nearly US$1 billion due to AI-driven ad systems.
- AppLovin plans to sell its app business for about US$900 million.
- First-quarter revenue projected between US$1.36 billion and US$1.39 billion, exceeding the US$1.32 billion estimate.

items.title: Google to test AI for age verification, starting in US
items.author: Jenn Fitzpatrick
items.summary:
- Google announced plans to test AI technology for estimating users’ ages to improve age restrictions on platforms like YouTube.
- The AI tool will launch in the US this year and will identify if users are over or under 18.
- This initiative is in response to increased pressure from lawmakers for enhanced online child safety.
- Plans to expand AI-based age verification to other countries in the future.
- Meta, Google’s rival, introduced similar AI-driven age verification features in September 2024.

items.title: Apple is reportedly exploring robotics, eyes 2028 launch
items.summary:
- Apple is investigating both humanoid and non-humanoid robotic designs according to analyst Ming-Chi Kuo.
- The research is in the early proof-of-concept stage, with a potentially optimistic timeline for mass production in 2028.
- Focus is on user interaction, sensing hardware, and software, with speculation about integration into a future smart home ecosystem.
- The company faces challenges similar to those experienced with the Apple Car project, including hiring constraints and production scaling issues.

items.title: Embattled unicorn eFishery accelerates mass layoffs
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- eFishery is planning to lay off up to 90% of its employees as part of an ongoing crisis.
- Layoffs are expected to begin on February 13, with another round potentially later this month.
- Remaining employees will mainly be from core business areas related to the fish and shrimp value chains.
- The company instructed all employees to work from home due to an office sterilization process, while some received immediate termination notices.
- The layoffs follow management changes and allegations of financial fraud, leading to an internal probe launched in December 2024.
- eFishery reached unicorn status in 2023 after significant funding from investors including Temasek Holdings and SoftBank.

items.title: Adobe launches new AI video tool
items.summary:
- Adobe launched a new AI video generation tool priced at US$0.50 per five-second video.
- Subscription plans are available at US$9.99 and US$29.99 per month.
- The tool can create videos, photos, illustrations, and audio, offering limited free access for Adobe Creative Cloud subscribers.
- This launch positions Adobe against competitors like OpenAI and Runway.
- Adobe integrates its Firefly AI model emphasizing user control and copyright safety, with Firefly logging 18 billion uses.
- The tool currently supports HD resolution with plans for additional resolution options.

items.title: India’s Anscer Robotics secures $2m to expand robot fleet
items.summary:
- Anscer Robotics raised US$2 million in a seed round led by Info Edge Ventures to expand its autonomous mobile robot (AMR) offerings.
- The startup provides AMRs for warehouses and factories, including pallet movers, tuggers, and conveyors, with deployments in India, the US, Singapore, and Japan.
- Funding will support market expansion and new product development, emphasizing Anscer’s expertise in industrial automation.
- This investment aligns with India’s deeptech growth supported by government initiatives like the proposed deeptech Fund of Funds.

items.title: Apple TV app now available on Android
items.summary:
- Apple Inc. is launching an Android app for its TV+ streaming service.
- Announcement expected as early as February 13.
- This marks the first time Apple TV+ will be accessible on Android devices, previously available only on Apple operating systems and select third-party platforms like Roku.
- Apple typically restricts services to its ecosystem, with few exceptions like the Music app for Android.

items.title: CATL expands into robotics
items.summary:
- CATL is expanding into robotics and advanced technologies in response to slower battery business growth. 
- A new team in Shanghai will develop industrial robots, including robotic arms and AGVs, for CATL's battery plants. 
- The company is also exploring humanoid robotics and engaging with manufacturers for potential investments. 
- In addition to robotics, CATL is researching room-temperature superconductors and nuclear fusion, indicating a broader strategy in advanced technology.

items.title: OpenAI set to release GPT-4.5 within weeks
items.summary:
- OpenAI will release its next generative AI model, GPT-4.5, in the coming weeks.
- CEO Sam Altman shared this news on X, calling the model Orion.
- This launch signals the end of the current AI system development approach by OpenAI.
- GPT-4.5 will be the last model developed without advanced computing power for simulating human-like reasoning.

items.title: Saudi fintech firm RasMal nets $4.8m pre-series A
items.summary:
* RasMal raised 18 million riyal (US$4.8 million) in a pre-series A round.
* The funding round was led by Syndicate Element Holding Group and announced at LEAP Riyadh 2025.
* RasMal specializes in cap table management and investment governance with AI-driven solutions.
* The investment will enhance automation in equity transfers and fundraising, supporting Saudi Vision 2030 goals.

items.title: Reddit shares drop 15% as user growth slows
items.summary:
- Reddit Inc. reported a 15% decline in shares due to weaker-than-expected user growth in Q4.
- The platform averaged 101.7 million daily active users, less than the expected 103.8 million.
- The decline in user growth was linked to changes in Google's search algorithm affecting traffic.
- Google accounts for up to 50% of Reddit's daily traffic, highlighting the importance of search visibility.
- Despite user growth miss, Reddit’s holiday quarter sales surged 71% to $427.7 million, exceeding the $405 million analyst estimates.

items.title: TSMC holds first US board meeting, no new investments
items.summary:
- TSMC held its first US board meeting on Feb. 12 in Arizona.
- No new US investments were announced despite market speculation.
- Current investment in Arizona totals US$65 billion across three wafer fabrication plants.
- The first facility is producing 4 nm chips; the second is set for 3 nm and 2 nm production by 2028.
- The third facility will utilize a next-generation A16 2 nm technology.
- The board approved US$17.14 billion for technology upgrades and improvements.
- Up to US$10 billion was allocated for foreign exchange hedging for TSMC Global Ltd.

items.title: Roblox adds Arabic support as MENA user base grows
items.author: David Baszucki
items.summary:
- Roblox introduces Arabic language support on desktop, mobile, PlayStation, and Xbox platforms.
- Announcement made by CEO David Baszucki at the World Government Summit in Dubai.
- Arabic is the 16th language on Roblox, reflecting growth in the MENA region, with 80% increase in daily active users from Q3 2021 to Q3 2024.
- Engagement hours rose by 76% in five MENA countries, including the UAE and Saudi Arabia.
- New features include text chat filtering, moderation, automatic translation tools, and parental controls in Arabic.
- A study shows Roblox's economic contributions to MENA's GDP grew by 55% year-over-year in 2024.

items.title: Meta in talks to acquire South Korean AI chip startup
items.summary:
- FuriosaAI, a South Korean AI chip startup, is in acquisition talks with Meta Platforms, potentially concluding by the end of February.
- FuriosaAI develops AI inference accelerators, including the RNGD chip launched in August, which is cost-effective compared to Nvidia's offerings.
- The RNGD chip is priced at around US$10,000, significantly cheaper than Nvidia’s US$40,000 H100.
- The acquisition fits Meta's goal of reducing dependence on Nvidia as demand for AI processors increases.
- Meta has its own MTIA chip but is not fully independent yet.
- Following the news, shares of FuriosaAI’s investors rose on Korea’s Kosdaq market.

items.title: OpenAI to discontinue o3 model for GPT-5 launch
items.summary:
- OpenAI announced plans to discontinue the “o3” AI model as a standalone product.
- CEO Sam Altman stated on Feb. 13 that the o-series will be integrated with GPT-series models.
- Upcoming GPT-5 will consolidate “o3” and other technologies into a single AI system.
- No release timeline for GPT-5 was provided.
- The “o3” and “o3 mini” models were first introduced in December 2024.

items.title: Microsoft backs Saudi gaming startups with new program
items.summary:
- Microsoft partners with Merak Capital to enhance Saudi Arabia’s gaming startup ecosystem.
- Startups will receive technology resources, mentoring, and access to international markets.
- Microsoft will provide Azure cloud services, game development tools, and industry expertise.
- The partnership includes the Exel Gaming Accelerator, focused on AI, cloud technology, and analytics.
- This initiative supports the existing US$80 million Gaming Fund and the goals of Saudi Vision 2030.
- Applications for the first cohort of the Exel Gaming Accelerator are open until Feb. 16, targeting startups with scalable business models.

items.title: US game engine giant Unity cuts jobs, scales back in Israel
items.summary:
- Unity Technologies is undergoing layoffs as part of restructuring efforts.
- Specific number of job cuts not disclosed, but entire departments were affected, particularly in Israel.
- Nadav Ashkenazy, Chief Revenue Officer of Unity’s Tel Aviv office, will be leaving in the coming months.
- Layoffs mark a shift in Unity’s ad division with responsibilities moving to North America.
- CEO Matthew Bromberg emphasized the need for efficiency and integration of ironSource’s LevelPlay into Unity’s operations.
- Prior strategies were acknowledged to have faced challenges and did not meet expectations.
- The revenue organization is now being restructured into two global teams with minimal ties to the Tel Aviv office.

items.title: Indian cloud storage startup Lucidity nets $21m series A
items.author: Vatsal Rastogi, Nitin Bhadauria
items.summary:
- Lucidity raised US$21 million in a series A funding round led by WestBridge Capital, with participation from Alpha Wave.
- The funding will be used to expand its marketing team and enhance enterprise storage management solutions.
- Founded in 2021, Lucidity offers AI-powered software for effective cloud storage management, automating provisioning and ensuring compatibility with AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.

items.title: Saudi logistics startup Pieship raises $2.1m seed funding
items.author: Nasser Alharthi, Musaed Al-Amri, Mohammed Mohsen
items.summary:
- Pieship has raised $2.1 million in seed funding led by Nama Ventures, with participation from Seedra Ventures and angel investors.
- The funding follows a pre-seed investment completed in 2024.
- Founded in late 2023, Pieship utilizes AI for shipment analysis and route optimization.
- Plans to expand operations to major Saudi cities include Jeddah, Makkah, Madinah, Dammam, Al Khobar, Qassim, and Khamis Mushait.
- Aiming to grow its registered driver network to 5,000 for improved delivery efficiency.

items.title: Indian AI wealthtech startup ArthAlpha raises $2m
items.author: Rohit Beri, Rohit Jha
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based investment platform ArthAlpha raised US$2 million in funding led by DSP.
- Funds will enhance AI-powered research tools, improve data infrastructure, and expand portfolio management services.
- ArthAlpha plans to develop a quantitative investment platform for other investment firms.
- Founded in 2024, ArthAlpha focuses on AI-driven investment research and portfolio management.
- The startup is competing in India’s wealthtech sector against platforms like 5paisa, Angel One, and Groww.
- This funding indicates rising investor interest in AI startups in India, which have raised over US$600 million since 2019.

items.title: Nature startup Chestnut Carbon raises $160m series B
items.summary:
- Chestnut Carbon, a nature startup, successfully raised $160 million in a Series B funding round.
- The funding will be utilized to enhance their carbon capture technologies and expand operations.
- Investors included major venture capital firms and initiatives focused on sustainability.

items.title: OpenAI disputes copyright claims from Indian media groups
items.summary:
- OpenAI opposes Indian media groups joining a copyright lawsuit against it, filed on Feb. 11.
- Claims it did not use content from these groups to train ChatGPT.
- The original lawsuit was initiated by ANI last year for unauthorized use of its content.
- Other organizations like NDTV and the Indian Express have sought to join the case.
- OpenAI asserts it doesn't need partnership agreements for public data use.

items.title: Baidu plans to launch self-driving taxis in Dubai: sources
items.summary:
- Baidu is considering launching its robotaxi service, Apollo Go, in Dubai.
- This would be Baidu's first venture into the Middle East to expand its autonomous vehicle technology.
- The company is in discussions with UAE authorities about the potential launch.
- No official statement from Baidu has been issued regarding this development.

items.title: German fast food startup Lanch raises $27m for expansion
items.author: Nono Konopka, Dominic Kluge, Jonas Meynert, Kevin Kock
items.summary:
- German startup Lanch raised €26 million (US$27 million) in a Series A funding round.
- Investment co-led by Felix Capital and HV Capital.
- Funds will be used for expansion in Germany and potential new markets.
- Lanch utilizes social media data and influencer partnerships for food brand development.
- The startup introduced three brands: Loco Chicken, Happy Slice Pizza, and Happy Chips.

items.title: Saudi fintech BuildNow secures $10m in debt, equity funding
items.summary:
- BuildNow raised $10 million in funding through debt and non-dilutive equity.
- Funding provided by Arbah Capital and STV.
- Partnered with Joa Capital to create an $80 million trade finance initiative.
- Focuses on buy now, pay later (BNPL) solutions for SMEs seeking credit for material procurement.

items.title: Conflict in Google Cloud APAC casts shadow on catch-up bid
items.summary:
- Google Cloud is in third place behind AWS and Microsoft, with a revenue growth slowdown to 30% year-on-year in Q4 2024.
- Internal conflicts within the Asia-Pacific (APAC) division may hinder Google's ambitions in the cloud market.
- Complaints from staff regarding unequal opportunities and low morale have reportedly gone unaddressed.
- There has been significant turnover among senior executives in the APAC team, with key positions frequently changing hands.

items.title: AI automation firm secures $55m from Microsoft-backed G42
items.summary:
- Abu Dhabi-based G42 leads a US$55 million Series A funding round for AppliedAI, a process automation startup.
- Funding contributors include Bessemer Venture Partners, Palantir, McKinsey, and Accrete Capital.
- The funds will enhance AppliedAI's team and AI tools, focusing on industries like healthcare, insurance, government, and financial services.
- AppliedAI was founded in the UK in 2021 and is now based in Abu Dhabi.
- G42, supported by Mubadala and Microsoft, aims to establish two AI centers in Abu Dhabi to promote AI technologies and training.

items.title: Saudi tech firm to export industrial robots by May 2025
items.author: Amit Midha
items.summary:
- Alat, a Saudi Arabian company backed by the Public Investment Fund, will start exporting industrial robots globally by May 2025.
- CEO Amit Midha announced the plan during the Private Sector Forum in Riyadh on Feb. 12.
- The robots are produced in Riyadh and aim to enhance manufacturing efficiency and reduce automation costs.
- The initiative follows a joint venture between Alat and Japan’s SoftBank Group established in February 2024.
- Alat also plans to export laptops, PCs, and servers by late 2025 through a partnership with Lenovo.
- Founded in 2024, Alat is aligned with Saudi Arabia’s Vision 2030, focusing on AI integration in automation.
- The Saudi Industrial Development Fund has invested 161 billion riyals (US$42.93 billion) to strengthen local industries.

items.title: Meta extends AI server life, cuts $2.9b in 2025 costs
items.summary:
- Meta Platforms extends depreciation period for AI infrastructure to 5.5 years.
- Expected reduction in depreciation expenses by $2.9 billion in 2025, nearly 4% of projected pre-tax profits.
- Increase in capital expenditures by up to 75% this year to enhance AI technologies.
- Financial impact of this change anticipated to be larger in 2026.
- CFO Susan Li cites 'efficiency gains' for the extension, similar moves made by other tech companies.
- Microsoft and Oracle have also extended their server lifespans while Amazon reduced theirs.

items.title: Singapore’s IMDA creates leadership role for genAI
items.summary:
- Singapore's Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA) has established a new leadership role focused on generative artificial intelligence (genAI).
- The role involves developing and integrating genAI solutions across IMDA, including strategizing, managing teams, and ensuring ethical governance.
- Candidates should have 10 years of experience in AI or machine learning, with at least five years in leadership roles, and must possess technical expertise in machine learning frameworks.

items.title: Petronas FutureTech 4.0 invites startups to regional roadshows
items.summary:
- Petronas Ventures and BCG X.Ventures Southeast Asia are hosting regional events for the FutureTech 4.0 accelerator program.
- Roadshows will occur in Johor (Feb. 15), Bangkok (Feb. 20), and Singapore (Feb. 25).
- Startups will gain access to industry leaders, guidance, piloting opportunities, and corporate partnerships.

items.title: AI drives Shell’s energy transformation
items.summary:
- Shell's first global energy outlook released in two years highlights AI's potential impact on energy by 2050.
- Oil demand expected to rise by 3-5 million barrels per day until the 2030s, natural gas demand projected to grow until the 2040s.
- Three AI-driven energy scenarios outlined by Shell exceed the 1.5°C Paris Agreement limit but show progress in decarbonization and carbon removal.

items.title: SoftBank reports $2.4b loss in Q3
items.summary:
- SoftBank reported a net loss of 369 billion yen (US$2.4 billion) for Q3 2023, contrasting with a profit of 950 billion yen (US$6.2 million) during the same period last year.
- The loss was largely attributed to a 309 billion yen (US$2 billion) deficit in the Vision Fund, influenced by decreasing valuations of public holdings such as Coupang and Didi.
- SoftBank is pursuing a US$500 billion AI initiative named Stargate in collaboration with OpenAI, aiming to strengthen AI infrastructure despite the volatility of the Vision Fund.

items.title: [Shein](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=shein), Temu sales dip after Trump’s trade move
items.summary:
- Shein and [Temu](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=temu) experience significant sales drops due to potential new US trade policies.
- Shein’s US sales declined by 16% to 41% from February 5 to February 9, while Temu's sales decreased by up to 32%.
- The proposed policy to end duty exemptions for small imports could affect consumer spending, despite the delay in implementation.
- Shein is encouraging suppliers to move production to Vietnam to mitigate impacts, and Temu is using a 'half-custody' model to adjust supply chain operations.

items.title: Should Temasek reel in startup bets?
items.summary:
- Temasek and other state-linked funds under scrutiny after eFishery fraud allegations.
- Due diligence emphasized for state-linked investors due to public money involvement.
- History of failed investments raises questions about the responsibility of such funds.
- A fund-of-funds strategy suggested as a safer investment approach for state-linked investors.

items.title: Ant International opens first Middle East office in Saudi
items.summary:
- Ant International, a digital payment provider, opens its first Middle East office in Saudi Arabia.
- The office aims to enhance collaboration with local payment partners, focusing on small and medium-sized enterprises.
- The company plans to launch its payment solution, Antom, later this year, facilitating payments in over 100 currencies.

items.title: 20 largest exits in India
items.summary:
- India has witnessed numerous mergers and acquisitions (M&A) over the years, including both blockbuster and less notable deals.
- Data on M&A transactions in India is scarce, prompting the creation of this focused overview.
- M&A transactions can vary in structure, including all-stock, cash, or a combination, meaning high values do not guarantee good shareholder returns.
- The dataset may have limitations and the authors welcome feedback for corrections or missing information at research@techinasia.com.

items.title: Global EV sales rise 18% in January as Europe leads
items.summary:
- Global sales of electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles rose by 18% year-on-year in January 2025, totaling 1.3 million units.
- Europe and North America experienced the fastest growth, outpacing China for the first time since February 2024.
- In Europe, EV sales increased by 21% to 250,000 units, influenced by new CO2 emission targets from the EU.
- The United States and Canada saw a 22.1% increase in EV sales, reaching 130,000 units.
- Global regions, in general, reported a 50% increase in sales year-on-year.
- China's sales reached 700,000 units, an 11.8% increase from the previous year, but down 43% from December due to the Chinese New Year holiday.

items.title: [Foxconn](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=foxconn) seeks Nissan partnership in EVs
items.summary:
- Foxconn aims to establish a cooperative relationship with [Nissan](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=nissan) rather than acquiring the company.
- Chairman Young Liu stated, 'Purchasing its shares is not our aim; our aim is cooperation.'
- Liu mentioned that acquiring a stake in Nissan could be considered if it facilitates collaboration.

items.title: [Orbit Startups](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=orbit_startups) raises $60m to support entrepreneurs
items.summary:
- Orbit Startups has successfully raised $60 million to aid entrepreneurs.
- The funding aims to support startup growth and innovation.
- This investment will particularly focus on areas that have been underfunded in the past.

items.title: Ex-OpenAI scientist’s firm expands to Tel Aviv, eyes $20b
items.author: Ilya Sutskever, Daniel Levy, Daniel Gross
items.summary:
- Safe Superintelligence (SSI) is an AI startup co-founded by former OpenAI chief scientist Ilya Sutskever.
- The company is expanding in Tel Aviv and relocating to Midtown, adding to its Silicon Valley presence.
- Founded in May 2024, SSI has raised US$1 billion at a US$5 billion valuation from investors like Sequoia Capital and Andreessen Horowitz.
- SSI is reportedly seeking additional funding to potentially raise its valuation to US$20 billion.
- The firm aims to develop advanced AI models that surpass human intelligence while aligning with human interests, although specific technologies or products have not been disclosed.

items.title: US chip toolmaker Lam Research to invest $1.2b in India
items.summary:
- Lam Research plans to invest over 100 billion rupees (approximately US$1.2 billion) in Karnataka, India.
- The investment was announced during the ‘Invest Karnataka’ event on Feb. 12.
- The Karnataka government is promoting the sector expansion with a US$10 billion incentive package.
- India’s semiconductor market is projected to reach a valuation of US$63 billion by 2026.

items.title: Binance, US SEC request 60-day pause in legal battle
items.summary:
- Binance and the US SEC requested a 60-day pause in their legal case due to a new cryptocurrency task force.
- The SEC filed a lawsuit against Binance for trading volume inflation and fund mismanagement in June 2023.
- The newly launched SEC crypto task force aims to address regulatory challenges and potentially help resolve the case.

items.title: Deliveroo dismisses rumors of CEO exit
items.summary:
- Deliveroo confirmed CEO Will Shu will remain in his role, dismissing speculation.
- A company spokesperson stated there are no plans for Shu to step down.
- Will Shu co-founded Deliveroo in 2013 and holds over 6% of the company, making him its third-largest shareholder.
- Recent developments include the closure of cloud kitchens in Singapore due to rising operating costs and slowing demand from restaurants.
- Other notable timelines include the IPO plans in 2021, significant funding rounds, and the introduction of contactless delivery measures during the Covid-19 pandemic.

items.title: [Alibaba](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=alibaba) shares soar 7% on AI collaboration with [Apple](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=apple)
items.summary:
- Alibaba Group shares surged over 7% following news of its collaboration with Apple for AI features in China.
- Reports indicate that both companies have submitted their AI developments for regulatory approval.
- In contrast, shares of another key AI competitor, Baidu, remained stable in Hong Kong.
